title: MDBX warning after a ZFS rollback
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`

OS & Version: Linux

Commit hash : 62bbc36d113d1f3c5646a45228be584958303d27

#### Expected behaviour

No warning from `mdbx`

#### Actual behaviour

Shows warning about `mdbx`

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Run the node on ZFS, and then rollback on a snapshot from a few mins ago. Delete the `chaindata` folder and run the node again. I don't want to restart full sync from an empty pool as I don't want to re-download the torrent snapshot.
#### Backtrace

```

WARN[09-17|23:32:40.410] nodeDB.QuerySeeds failed                 err="failed MdbxKV cursor.Seek(): mdbx_cursor_get: MDBX_CORRUPTED: Maybe free space is over on disk. Otherwise it's hardware failure. Before creating issue please use tools like https://www.memtest86.com to test RAM and tools like https://www.smartmontools.org to test Disk. To handle hardware risks: use ECC RAM, use RAID of disks, run multiple application instances (or do backups). If hardware checks passed - check FS settings - 'fsync' and 'flock' must be enabled.  Otherwise - please create issue in Application repo. On default DURABLE mode, power outage can't cause this error. On other modes - power outage may break last transaction and mdbx_chk can recover db in this case, see '-t' and '-0|1|2' options., bucket: NodeRecord,  key: 6e3a027826f75d7bcdd05296fbc7bf2a976d1450f0bfbe49cb5b53510f63789c7b863a7634"
```

I'm not sure if I should just restart the node on a fresh pool or ignore the warning.

Maybe free space is over on disk. Otherwise it's hardware failure. Before creating issue please use tools like https://www.memtest86.com to test RAM and tools like https://www.smartmontools.org to test Disk. To handle hardware risks: use ECC RAM, use RAID of disks, run multiple application instances (or do backups). If hardware checks passed - check FS settings - 'fsync' and 'flock' must be enabled.  Otherwise - please create issue in Application repo. On default DURABLE mode, power outage can't cause this error. On other modes - power outage may break last transaction and mdbx_chk can recover db in this case, see '-t' and '-0|1|2' options.
